New Records: Toronto Raptors recorded their worst season opener loss in franchise history with a 30-point defeat to the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Key Match Events: Chris Boucher led the Raptors in scoring with 18 points.
Gradey Dick, in his second year, scored 16 points for the Raptors.
Evan Mobley scored 25 points for the Cleveland Cavaliers.
The Raptors were outscored 36-17 in the second quarter and committed more turnovers than made shots.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Boucher commented on the loss, stating it was a wake-up call for the young team and emphasized the need to play harder.
Optimism was expressed by a fan for the return of RJ Barrett, suggesting paint points will be easier when he is back.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Raptors' loss was noted as poetic by a fan, referencing the 30-point loss on their 30th anniversary.
The Raptors' next game is against the Philadelphia 76ers, coached by former Raptors head coach Nick Nurse.
